author.name: Rachel Atherton-Charvat
author.description: Author, photographer & former history teacher. Writing about travelling the ancient cities of Asia Minor and Greece & 2nd novel. Gloucester Rugby,cricket & NCFC

html:
Ruggero Room
Commissioned by William I (1154-66).Showing allegorical emblems of Norman power.A Swabian eagle sits in the centre of the ceiling. Persian and Seljuk influence bring together both the Islamic and Byzantine worlds.
Norman Palace of Palermo
📷June
#MosaicMonday #Sicily https://t.co/Ml9MsARLq7

author.name: ArchaeoHistories
author.description: History is an unending dialogue between present and the past, that's why few pages of history give more insight than all the metaphysical volumes.

html:
A 2000 year old Roman mosaic washed by waters of mighty river Euphrates in ancient city of Zeugma in Türkiye.

It was discovered in 2000 in a Roman villa of ancient city during rescue excavations and it is thought to date from 1st century CE.

#archaeohistories https://t.co/RMRx1wvK71

html: Akhal Teke from Turkmenistan Teke tribe or Desert Horse is one of oldest and most beautiful breeds. They have a reputation for speed and endurance, intelligence and a distinctive metallic shine. Looks like glass, pearl, silk, coming from a fairytale.\n\n#archaeohistories https://t.co/Ijjz02IXus

author.name: Codex OS

html:
Persian Warriors Relief (510 BC), from The Palace of Darius I; Susa - Persia (Iran)

Persian Warriors (thought to represent the Immortals) detail of the frieze of the archers in the palace of Darius in Susa. Silicon glazed bricks.

#archaeohistories https://t.co/a0F895e2Rx

author.description: History is an unending dialogue between present and the past, that's why few pages of history give more insight than all the metaphysical volumes.

html:
Fragment of relief, representing cartridges of Pharaoh Tutmes III. Dated (1479-1425 BC), 18th Dynasty; New Empire.

Tutmes was buried in Deir el-Bahari, complex of graves and mortuary temples, of ancient Egyptians, located on bank of Nile river, opposite side Luxor.

Luxor Museum https://t.co/rmzR7ep29N

author.name: Alison Fisk

html:
For #FindsFriday, beautiful blue glass beads from Iron Age Germany, 2,600 years ago! 

From ‘Rauer Lehen’ burial mound, Ertingen. Halstatt period, 7th century BC. Landesmuseum Württemberg. 📷: my own

html:
Scarab bracelet from Tutankhamun's Tomb, 14th Century BC.

Tomb of the 18th Dynasty Ancient Egyptian Pharaoh Tutankhamun was discovered in 1922 by the British archaeologist Howard Carter.

Egyptian Museum, Cairo
